solution_line_template: First find the total number of monthly commutes: {days_per_week} days/week * {weeks_per_month} weeks/month = <<{days_per_week}*{weeks_per_month}={monthly_commutes_days}>>{monthly_commutes_days} days/month

Then multiply the distance of the commute one way by the two ways: {commute_one_way_miles} miles * {two_ways_factor} = <<{commute_one_way_miles}*{two_ways_factor}={commute_round_trip_miles}>>{commute_round_trip_miles} miles

Then multiply the number of commutes by the number of miles per commute: {commute_round_trip_miles} miles/commute * {monthly_commutes_days} commutes = <<{commute_round_trip_miles}*{monthly_commutes_days}={total_monthly_miles}>>{total_monthly_miles} miles

Then divide the number of miles by the car's gas mileage: {total_monthly_miles} miles / {car_mpg} miles/gallon = <<{total_monthly_miles}/{car_mpg}={gallons_needed_monthly}>>{gallons_needed_monthly} gallons

Then multiply that number by the cost of each gallon to find the total cost: {gallons_needed_monthly} gallons * ${gas_cost_per_gallon}/gallon = $<<{gallons_needed_monthly}*{gas_cost_per_gallon}={total_monthly_gas_cost}>>{total_monthly_gas_cost}

Then divide the total cost by the number of friends to find the cost per person: ${total_monthly_gas_cost} / {num_friends} people = $<<{total_monthly_gas_cost}/{num_friends}={cost_per_person_monthly}>>{cost_per_person_monthly}/person
